p: Relative to SOC, both the brief and combined interventions reduced the mean (SE) number of drinks per drinking day (4.2 [0.3] vs 3.4 [0.3] and 2.9 [0.2], respectively) at 12 months (eTable 6 and eTable 7 in Supplement 2). Likewise, compared with SOC, the mean (SE) number of heavy drinking days was lower among participants in the brief and combined interventions (6.7 [1.0] vs 3.7 [0.7] and 3.4 [0.7], respectively) at 12 months (eTable 8 and eTable 9 in Supplement 2).
